fine_dining.name: Ria Formosa Restaurant
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant rooftop dining with panoramic views of Ria Formosa Natural Park
fine_dining.booking_tips: Request a window table for the best views; book several days in advance during high season
fine_dining.local_tips: Run by chef Alberto Carvalho; spectacular sunset views over the city and lagoon; try the chocolate brownie with Algarvian orange ice cream for dessert.

fine_dining.name: Restaurante Faz Gostos
fine_dining.atmosphere: Sophisticated dining in the historic center
fine_dining.booking_tips: The only Michelin Guide listed restaurant in Faro; reserve at least a week ahead
fine_dining.local_tips: Excellent wine list focusing on Portuguese varieties; seasonal menu using fresh ingredients from the Ria Formosa; tasting menu recommended for the full experience.

fine_dining.name: Portas de São Pedro
fine_dining.atmosphere: Intimate dining with sophisticated yet unpretentious setting
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book at least a few days ahead; slightly off the tourist track
fine_dining.local_tips: Tapas-style sharing plates make this ideal for groups; regularly changing menu based on seasonal ingredients; known among locals as one of Faro's best kept secrets.

casual_dining.name: Se7e Pedras
signature_dishes: Lentil Dish with Depth of Flavors
casual_dining.atmosphere: Contemporary and stylish with beautiful alleyway setting
casual_dining.local_tips: The home of petiscos (Portuguese tapas) in Faro; ever-changing creative menu; best experienced by ordering multiple small plates to share; craft beer available from neighboring Grains 864.

casual_dining.name: A Venda
signature_dishes: Black Iberico Pork with Pickled Onions
casual_dining.atmosphere: Rustic and authentic with grandmother's lounge vibe
casual_dining.booking_tips: Smaller venue; consider arriving early for dinner service
casual_dining.local_tips: Authentic homemade dishes; substantial vegetarian selection; cozy atmosphere makes you feel like you're having food with a Portuguese grandmother; everything made from scratch.

casual_dining.name: Tasca do Ricky
casual_dining.atmosphere: Small, traditional tasca with local ambiance
casual_dining.booking_tips: Small restaurant requiring reservations; locals' favorite
casual_dining.local_tips: Family-run restaurant serving authentic Algarvian dishes; friendly owner often greets guests personally; excellent value for traditional dishes that are hard to find elsewhere.

casual_dining.name: Chefe Branco
casual_dining.booking_tips: Reservations recommended, especially for dinner; book a few days ahead
casual_dining.local_tips: Known for the best cataplana in Faro; try their monkfish version; authentic food that locals choose for special occasions; outdoor seating perfect for warm evenings; good selection of Portuguese wines.

street_food.name: Xic
specialties: Francesinha (iconic Portuguese sandwich with meat, cheese, spicy sauce)
street_food.local_tips: Considered by many to serve the best Francesinha in Faro; try the 'Francesinha Extra Xic' with multiple meats, egg and shrimp; popular with locals for this iconic Portuguese comfort food.

street_food.name: O Recife - Churrasqueira
street_food.local_tips: Follow your nose to find this local favorite; authentic Portuguese grilled chicken with secret piri-piri sauce; popular with locals including police officers and paramedics; consider takeaway if busy.

street_food.name: The Old Tavern
street_food.seating: Traditional tavern seating with outdoor tables
street_food.local_tips: Great location in the old town; popular among both locals and tourists; sharing boards are excellent for sampling multiple Portuguese specialties; lively atmosphere in the evenings.

coffee_shops.name: Soho Coffee
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Modern, comfortable café with international feel
coffee_shops.local_tips: Opens early (5am) to accommodate travelers; additional outlet in the non-Schengen area of the airport; quality fair trade coffee that stands out in Faro; good place to catch up on work.

coffee_shops.name: Papaya
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Bright, healthy vibe with casual seating
coffee_shops.food_options: Healthy sandwiches, salads, and breakfast items
coffee_shops.local_tips: Located near the marina; great spot for a healthy breakfast or lunch; plenty of vegetarian and vegan options; perfect for a quick energizing meal during sightseeing.

coffee_shops.name: Pastelaria Coelho
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Classic Portuguese pastelaria with local charm
coffee_shops.local_tips: Authentic local experience; excellent pastel de nata; frequented by locals rather than tourists; very reasonable prices; no-frills but genuine atmosphere.

bars.name: O Castelo
bars.atmosphere: Renovated space set within the ramparts of Faro's old town
bars.local_tips: Spectacular views over the Ria Formosa Natural Park; best place to watch the sunset in Faro; relaxed atmosphere; can get busy during peak tourist season.

bars.name: Epicur
bars.atmosphere: Sophisticated wine bar with knowledgeable staff
bars.local_tips: Expert owners passionate about Portuguese wines; excellent for discovering lesser-known Portuguese grape varieties; hosts wine tastings and workshops; great tapas menu to accompany your drinks.

bars.name: Cosmopolitan Rooftop Bar
signature_drinks: Concept cocktails like the candle-shaped 'Church' cocktail
At the Stadium cocktail served in a sports bottle
bars.atmosphere: Stylish rooftop setting with harbor views
bars.local_tips: Shares a terrace with Ria Formosa Restaurant atop Hotel Faro; innovative concept cocktails with unique presentations; panoramic views over the harbor and Ria Formosa; sophisticated atmosphere good for special occasions.

bars.name: Columbus Bar
bars.atmosphere: Design bar with exposed stone walls in historic building
bars.local_tips: Stylish interior combining modern design with historic elements; popular with locals and visitors alike; relaxed atmosphere for evening drinks; good starting point for a night out in Faro.

food_tours.name: Faro Food Tour
highlights: Visit to Municipal Market and traditional tascas
food_tours.booking_tips: Book at least a week in advance; comfortable walking shoes recommended; includes stops at authentic local restaurants off the tourist path.

food_tours.name: Ria Formosa Seafood Experience
highlights: Boat trip to the oyster and clam beds
Fresh seafood tastings directly from the source
Traditional seafood lunch on one of the islands
food_tours.booking_tips: Combines ecological tour of the Ria Formosa with gastronomy; includes boat transportation; book at least a week ahead; seafood lunch typically at Estaminé Restaurant on Ilha Deserta.

food_tours.name: Faro Wine & Tapas Walk
highlights: Tasting of regional Algarve and Portuguese wines
Hidden local wine bars and taverns
food_tours.booking_tips: Evening tour that includes multiple petiscos and wine tastings; educational component about Portuguese wines; visits several establishments; advance booking essential.

cooking_classes.name: Tertúlia Algarvia Cooking Workshop
includes: Market visit, all ingredients, recipe booklet, full meal with wines
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Hands-on class in English or Portuguese; includes visit to the local market; vegetarian options available on request; book at least a few days ahead.

cooking_classes.name: Cooking with Ria Formosa
includes: Boat trip to collect seafood, cooking instruction, meal with local wine pairings
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Unique experience combining boat trip to collect ingredients with cooking class; focuses on seafood from the Ria Formosa lagoon; reservations required well in advance, especially during high season.

markets.name: Mercado Municipal de Faro
highlights: Fresh fish and seafood from Ria Formosa
markets.local_tips: Recently renovated modern market; best visited early morning when fish selection is freshest; second floor contains small restaurants and cafés serving market-fresh ingredients; great place to see local food culture in action.

markets.name: Mercado da Alameda
highlights: Regional honey, olive oil, and preserves
markets.local_tips: Authentic local market experience; less touristy than the Municipal Market; great for picking up picnic supplies; vendors often willing to offer tastings; cash preferred.

markets.name: Estoi Market
markets.hours: Second Sunday of each month, 9 AM - 1 PM
markets.local_tips: Worth the short trip from Faro; held in the beautiful village of Estoi; combines well with a visit to the Estoi Palace; glimpse into traditional rural life of the Algarve; local crafts also available.

spring: Fava beans with chouriço and poached eggs
summer: Sardinhas assadas (Grilled sardines - peak season June to August)
Cataplana de marisco (Seafood stew in traditional copper pan)
Caracóis à Algarvia (Snails cooked in broth with herbs and spices - summer specialty)
autumn: Xarém com conquilhas (Cornmeal porridge with clams)
Figs and almonds from Algarve orchards
Javali (Wild boar stew with local mushrooms)
winter: Arroz de Polvo (Octopus rice - popular during Christmas season)
Doces finos do Algarve (Traditional Algarve sweets with almond, fig and carob)
